author: DANIEL ZELTER
subject: Re: Mamo and Dale
body:
""Liberty" is not that bad; plus, Manga could market it
with the tag line "David Copperfield is not the only
one that can make the Statue of Liberty disappear.""

I enjoyed Liberty too, but I'd rather Manga released the good Lupin movies 
(Harimao's Treasure, Walther and DOA) so that they could keep the audience 
interested in Lupin. Hopefully Walther won't be too tough to get being 3 
years old and about to be sold on J dvd. But then Macross 7 is 4 years old, 
and companies still haven't gotten the music rights to it.

"Probably because the license for it would have been wicked
expensive.  Mamo was a really old title by then meaning its
market value would be very low (as opposed to Cagliostro that
was labeled everywhere as a classic).  New = more money."

Pretty much. I asked reps at Streamline why there weren't more episodes of 
the show brought over here, and they said that the studio charged too much 
for the whole package, so they only asked for the Miyazaki stuff. Luckily 
though, there are no real arcs in the Lupin series (unless LGA knows 
something I don't ^^;) that would force me to go back to previous episodes 
in an effort to find out if I missed anything. Though I don't consider 
Nostramuas a worthy buy IMHO.
